alert.note: Alert for Assumption; Eastern Ascension; Iberville; Southern Livingston; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Western Ascension (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 12:03PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of St. John The Baptist, Ascension, St. James, southeastern Livingston, southeastern Iberville, northwestern Lafourche and Assumption Parishes through 100 PM CDT... At 1203 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Paincourtville, or near Napoleonville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gonzales, Donaldsonville, Napoleonville, Reserve, Laplace, St. Gabriel, Gramercy, Lutcher, Sorrento, French Settlement, Edgard, South Vacherie, Paincourtville, Geismar, Convent, North Vacherie, Garyville, Wallace, Supreme and Chackbay. This includes Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 173 and 203. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for southeastern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Assumption; Eastern Ascension; Iberville; Southern Livingston; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Western Ascension
